main event: Multiple witnesses reported a strange object in the sky on the night of August 23, 1956, which was described as round, brilliant blue-white in color, emitting a pulsating light, and exhibiting rapid acceleration and sudden stops before disappearing in the north.
interesting points: The object was seen by several persons in the area at the same time, indicating multiple credible witnesses.
The UFO moved rapidly at first, then slowed and stopped suddenly before accelerating rapidly and disappearing, demonstrating highly unusual behavior.
The object appeared to be at an altitude of between 1,000 and 2,000 feet, providing specific details about its position.
The report indicates that the object was dark in color and appeared to be hovering or stationary in the sky, adding to its mysterious nature.
Conclusions suggested that the sighting cannot be easily explained as a mundane situation, implying that it was likely an unidentified phenomenon.
Despite the extensive maneuvering, the object appeared to be visible for approximately 20 minutes, giving enough time for detailed observation.
sighted object: round, brilliant blue-white object emitting a pulsating light
